message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper proposes a novel RNN architecture for natural language processing tasks, specifically language modeling and sentence completion. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses in-depth analysis of linguistic dimensions captured by the RMN, which suggests that it may fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning) as well. The use of RMN also involves memory and attention mechanisms, which could place it under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper uses language modeling to demonstrate the effectiveness of RMN, which could also place it under cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) as language modeling is often used in natural language processing for image captioning and other related tasks.
